name: intellectualism
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the ability to think about or discuss a subject in a detailed and intelligent way, without involving your emotions or feelings: He wasn't intimidated by Kerry's intellectualism. She encouraged her father to offset his intellectualism with displays of emotion. See
intellectualize
More examplesFewer examplesIn Paris, proud intellectualism never went out of fashion. He believed that art, to be successful, must have an element of intellectualism.Not having a television was odd - the product of self-conscious intellectualism.
